title: Senior Product Manager - Marketing Platform
content:
We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager to join our growing Marking Platform team in London. Your mission is to enable the Marketing team to invest its budget to maximise ROI, with absolute confidence to use its data to underpin investment decisions. Risk should be minimised, and channel measurement must be clear and transparent.

You’ll contribute by:

Leading the team responsible for building and improving our marketing data infrastructure, ensuring our data is trustworthy and that it is flowing to all the right places
Influencing big decisions in allocation of spend - this team empowers Marketing to decide which channels and strategies to invest in.
Looking at Wise’s web tracking infrastructure (Google Tag Manager, our attribution pixel, web analytics implementation including Mixpanel), native app measurement setup (utilising our MMP Singular), our email infrastructure, and microservices passing data back to vendors like Google and Meta
Setting the overall frame of reference for decision-making in the team, balancing tradeoffs and ultimately ensuring the team works well and on the most impactful problems it can


This role will give you the opportunity to:

Directly contribute to our mission to make money without borders the new normal – you will need to figure out and build solutions so that our customers can move money instantly, conveniently, transparently, and – eventually – for free
Build world-class products: The role is a unique opportunity to build innovative, state-of-the-art solutions with a global impact.
Choose your path to impact – we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you’ll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you’ll have the freedom to make your own calls
Grow as a leader – You will build and inspire your own team, but also other teams to contribute to our mission
Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitude


A bit about you:

Customer-focused – You’ve worked on a product with thousands or even millions of customers, and built a deep understanding of the people who used your product. You’re able to define the impact of product investments you make.
You have a demonstrable record of collaborating with both paid and organic marketing teams, and are familiar with the challenges they face in measuring their performance 
You’re familiar with a wide range of marketing technology across both web and app measurement.
You’re data-driven – You are able to dive into data to identify opportunities and then measure your impact. You prioritise the value you can add to customers, and can get the entire company behind you by telling stories with data.
You have a good technical understanding - help your team prioritise technological investments, tech debt reduction, bugs and new features.
You communicate clearly and logically – You are able to effectively frame problems to influence across the team. You are comfortable communicating with internal and external partners on challenging issues, whether in written format or at sprint planning with the team
You’re not afraid of being a true lead, helping your team with hiring, learning skills you don’t know today to unblock things everywhere needed. You don’t stick to a “by the book” product manager role definition. You get it done


#LI-CH1Salary (annual)£83,000—£110,000 GBPWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent

questions.label: Do you live with a disability? (Disability covers mental and physical health impairments or conditions, including things like anxiety, visual or hearing impairments, long-term health conditions)
Why would you like to team-up with Wise?
Please tell us about a product / feature you've built, and what metrics moved on that product. How did you measure its success?
Had you heard of Wise before you started your job search?
Have you used Wise as a customer?
How did you hear about this job?
Please give an indication of your expected annual salary?
What is your current notice period?
Do you currently have the right to work in the UK? (e.g. Citizenship, ILR, Skilled Worker Visa etc.)
